result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas D Duessler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  
Transfer authorized to a jail convenient to defendant's employment and or residence.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
Court costs and fees shall be paid at a rate of $50 per month commencing 12-01-2022 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas D Duessler

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Douglas D. Duessler in court by Attorney Nolan A. Jensen.  Resolution reached with joint recommendation.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Douglas D. Duessler by authorization.  Offer pending.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on October 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant's Authorization for Attorney to Appear and Act
(Copy mailed to Def and Def Atty)

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Douglas D. Duessler in court without counsel.  Per request of defendant, Court appoints Atty. Nolan Jensen.   Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $100 per month commencing 9-01-2022.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Douglas D. Duessler in court without counsel.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.   Not guilty plea entered by Court.  Pretrial held with DA.  $1,000 signature bond set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
